Superintendent's Blog - Junior High Gym

As many of you know, seating capacity has long been an issue at the Junior High gym. Not quite as well known is that the gym floor was settling and cracking. Both issues have now been resolved.

The seating capacity has been increased from 126 to 376, and a new wooden floor has been laid over the old floor.

It is my hope that this better-functioning facility will be a source of Beecher pride for decades to come!

With school starting back this week, our school lunch program will have some changes.

Lunch counts will be taken in the morning. If your child wants a school lunch, they should let their teacher know at that time. For students with free/reduced lunches who are Remote Learners, grab and go lunches will be provided in the Junior High’s front drive from noon to 12:30 each day that school is in session.

If you have any questions about lunches (or anything else), please contact your child’s building office.

I really appreciate the dozens of staff and community members who donated their time to work on this plan, and in particular, our school nurses, Angie Cadwallader and Mary Kay Pittman.

Be safe. Be well.

As always, we feel that it is important to be transparent in our school activities. I would like to address Friday’s delivery rescheduling of educational materials.

Earlier in the week, Elementary school employees were diligently compiling next week’s resources. One of these employees has since learned that they were in brief contact last weekend with two people who have tested positive for COVID-19. This employee is currently not displaying any symptoms, but has self-quarantined nonetheless.

We immediately contacted the Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH), as they are the experts in these matters.

IDPH directed us to quarantine the materials until Monday, March 30th, at which point they would be safe to deliver.

Again, we have no proof that any materials were contaminated in the first place, but we are not taking any chances with the health of our families. Therefore, we are following the IDPH direction to keep everyone safe.

If you have any questions or concerns about this or anything else, please contact your teacher or Mrs. Black.
